messages.subject: Re: Fw: [MarylandUFC] unschooling gathering in DC
messages.msgSnippet: Joanna, Allison is 12 and Virginia is 10. I hope the hard frost we had recently has not spoiled the cherry blossoms.  A lot of the flowering trees around here
messages.messageBody:
Joanna,

Allison is 12 and Virginia is 10.

I hope the hard frost we had recently has not spoiled the cherry
blossoms. A lot of the flowering trees around here are not looking
as nice as usual.

Pat

messages.messageBody:
Pat,
I'm so glad!!See you there!
~Elissa Cleaveland

have
not yet entirely strangled the holy curiosity of inquiry." A. Einstein

messages.subject: Re: Fw: [MarylandUFC] unschooling gathering in DC
messages.msgSnippet: ... Yeah!! How old are your kids Pat?  2 girls right? I have Carly 11, Sam 8, Jack 5 and Jamie almost3. Our picture is in the photos section here. (I posted
messages.messageBody:
--- In AlwaysLearning@y..., "homeschoolmd" <homeschoolmd@y...> wrote:
> Elissa,
>
> We are in Crofton. DH has an appointment in Ellicott City which is
> 45 min. north west of here. He can drop us off in Baltimore and I
> think we can take a Marc Train into DC. We are determined to be
> there.
>
> Pat

Yeah!!
How old are your kids Pat? 2 girls right?
I have Carly 11, Sam 8, Jack 5 and Jamie almost3.
Our picture is in the photos section here. (I posted that in another
post that never showed up). Anyway, if you want to be able to spot
us easier, take a look.
Joanna

messages.subject: Re: Fw: [MarylandUFC] unschooling gathering in DC
messages.msgSnippet: Elissa, We are in Crofton.  DH has an appointment in Ellicott City which is 45 min. north west of here.  He can drop us off in Baltimore and I think we can
messages.messageBody:
Elissa,

We are in Crofton. DH has an appointment in Ellicott City which is
45 min. north west of here. He can drop us off in Baltimore and I
think we can take a Marc Train into DC. We are determined to be
there.

Pat

messages.msgSnippet: This get together sounds wonderful and definitely something I need unfortunately I won t have access to a car that day.  I m going to see if we can get a ride

This get together sounds wonderful and definitely something I need
unfortunately I won't have access to a car that day. I'm going to
see if we can get a ride to the metro station and somehow get there.

Pat Caldeira

of

messages.subject: Fw: [MarylandUFC] unschooling gathering in DC
messages.messageBody:
>Wednesday April 3, 2002 there will be a meeting of the like-minds!
>Unschoolers from around the area (DC) will converge upon the National mall
>by the thousands...er.. well, a few unschooling families from the national
>unschooling email loops (Always Learning and Unschooling-dotcom and
>homesteading homeschoolers) are meeting in front of the Museum of Natural
>History at 11:00 am. Some families are driving a couple hours to meet other
>unschoolers.
>Let's get down there and show our support to those who may have no other
>unschooling families in their area. Pack snacks, we'll sit under a cherry
>tree and chat, the kids can run and if the spirit moves us to actually DO
>something, we will !
>Montgomery and Frederick county folks may want to meet at the Shady Grove
>satellite parking lot at 10:00. Parking is free and a shuttle bus (also
>free) will take us right to the station.
>Please feel free to spread the words to other unschooling families, the
more
>the merrier!
>~Elissa Cleaveland
>"It is nothing short of a miracle that the modern methods of instruction
>have
>not yet entirely strangled the holy curiosity of inquiry." A. Einstein
>
>
>
>
>
>http://www.egroups.com/group/MarylandUFC
>
>To unsubscribe from this group, send an email to:
>MarylandUFC-unsubscribe@onelist.com
>
>
>
>Your use of Yahoo! Groups is subject to http://docs.yahoo.com/info/terms/
>
>
>
